Rosie Fernyhough  
 Bath  
@ rosiefernyhough@gmail.com  / info@millenable.com   
☎ +44 (0)7854883014  
Personal Statement  
I graduated from  the University of Bath  in 2012  with an MEng in Chemical Engineering  (Hons) , which also 
included a year in industry. After gaining useful experience in project engineering and draughting roles, I  opted 
to focus on the safety and reliability aspects of engineering.  I have since gained  experience  across multiple sectors  
in both perma nent roles  and fixed  term contracts via my limited company  (Millenable ). In addition, I am actively 
working towards achieving  Chartered Engineer (CEng) status with the Institution of Engineering and Technology 
(IET).  
Professional  Experience  
System Safety Engineer at Expleo      January  2021 to Prese Rosie Fernyhough  
 Bath  
@ rosiefernyhough@gmail.com  / info@millenable.com   
☎ +44 (0)7854883014  
Personal Statement  
I graduated from  the University of Bath  in 2012  with an MEng in Chemical Engineering  (Hons) , which also 
included a year in industry. After gaining useful experience in project engineering and draughting roles, I  opted 
to focus on the safety and reliability aspects of engineering.  I have since gained  experience  across multiple sectors  
in both perma nent roles  and fixed  term contracts via my limited company  (Millenable ). In addition, I am actively 
working towards achieving  Chartered Engineer (CEng) status with the Institution of Engineering and Technology 
(IET).  
Professional  Experience  
System Safety Engineer at Expleo      January  2021 to Present  
I provide  direct system safety engineering support to two of Expleo’s major engineering clients in the defence 
sector  (via s eparate contracts) . The  first contract  focussed on  the functional and physical safety aspects associated 
with a ‘future submarine’ programme, which was in t he 'Manufacturing' phase of the CADMID cycle. I produced 
key safety deliverables, such as hazard log updates and the generation of Design Safety Justification (DSJ) reports, 
within extremely tight timeframes . In addition,  I supplied weekly progress reports  to my client (Expleo), which 
they utilised to inform their key stakeholders (within Expleo's client's organisation) during high -level meetings. I 
received outstandingly positive feedback from the key stakeholders with regards to my overall contribution to  the 
system safety aspects of the 'future submarine' programme.  
The second cont ract currently f ocusses on the non -functional (physical), functional, and operational safety aspects 
associated with a  ‘mine countermeasures ’ system of systems , whic h is currently in the ‘Demonstration ’ and 
‘Manufacturing ’ phases of the CADMID cycle, depending on the specific sub -system in question. I manage the 
overarching hazard log for the e ntire programme. In addition, I chair hazard log review meetings and ensure that 
relevant actions are follow -up in a timely manner. I also attend site meetings , on the request of Expleo ’s client, 
when requ ired and report my findings to the Programme Lead(s) . I supply weekly progress reports to my client 
(Expleo) , which contri butes to Expleo ’s progress reports to their client.  
Safety Engineer at Babcock International Group    September  2019 to December 2020  
I provided system safety engineering services as contingent resource to the Safety Services Group (SSG), who 
support Babcock’s Engineering Delivery Group (EDG) in delivering design changes to the MoD, with occasional 
travel to MoD Abbey Wood to attend key safety -related meetings. Prior to scribing  and/or co-chairing these 
meetings, I produced Hazard Identification and Assessment (HIA) briefing packs, w hich included  Environmental 
Impact Screening and Scoping (EISS), in preparation for stimulating relevant di scussions and recording the main 
outcomes. I also drafted the primary deliverable(s); the  subsequent Safety and Environmental Assessment Report 
(SEAR)  for the design change under assessment . 
Other activities I completed during this contract included (but w ere not limited to): Project management activities, 
including liaising with MoD/SSMG task owners to arrange meetings and ensuring that project deliverables are 
produced to the correct specifications and in accordance with the project delivery schedule; Rev iew of safety 
deliverables produced by Babcock Energy and Marine (E&M) and BMT; Updating Safety Summary Reports 
(SSRs); Using SSMG applications, including Soter, R -DAR and Design Change; and mentoring other team 
members, including new graduates (as part of  the Babcock Engineering Graduate Scheme), by assigning tasks, 
monitoring progress, and providing useful feedback.  
Safety Consultant at BMT       December 201 8 to July 2019  
I was responsible for producing Safety and Environmental Case Reports (SECRs) for eq uipment used on surfaced 
maritime platforms with a UK defence application. I liaised directly w

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
